Reviews.Title: “Treated like family”
Reviews.Author: Deborah D
Reviews.Content: I would return to this B&B in a heartbeat! From the time Giorgio picked us up from the airport, we felt like we were part of his family. He went out of his way to answer questions, even had several discussions about Italy, family life, etc. Giorgio and Fulvio are charming and gracious hosts! My girlfriend and I shared the bedroom with the private bath which was adequate both in size and comfort. Even though the pigneto district is not at the center of Rome, it doesn't take long to get to the termini stazione where tram, bus, and metro can be accessed. The neighborhood is charming and artsy with many small shops, gelaterias, restaurants, etc. If you want to feel like a Roman and not a tourist, this is the place for you. We rarely saw other guests and came to feel like this was our own private flat in Rome. Great experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, enhanced our experience at Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Adomas N
Reviews.Content: At first, when we arrived at the hotel with my girlfriend, the quarter of Pigneto seemed a bit unwelcoming because it already had been late evening and there were not so many people outside, most of local food and drink stores closed. It all changed when host Giorgio arrived (we were first met by Fulvio, who doesn't speak much English). He was full of life and seemed genuinely excited to see people come and appreciate Rome and its rich culture, he was even kind enough to answer questions unrelated to sights/eating at lenght and depth. He helped us a lot by recommending what places we should see first, how to plan our route and also local restaurants and markets. Both in Pigneto and our little B&B you can sense the native atmosphere which is hardly found in the touristy areas. The B&B is basically flat and you feel right at home. The small Pigneto quarter is filled with bars, food stores and restaurants run by locals. While the location is not the nearest to the centre, it is very convenient to go the Rome center by tram or bus, it will take up between 30 minutes and 1 hour to most tourist attractions. The breakfast doesn't change day-to-day and is quite generic (toast, ham, cheese, jam, tea or coffee, juice), but if you feel you lack something, Fulvio assists and brings more. By the way, you can choose the breakfast time yourselves, as long as it is reasonable. There are three rooms, one is with an internal bathroom (but it has no internal entrance to the lovely terrace), we have been in this one and after a while (we stayed 7 nights around New Year time) moved to another room and it was equally fine, because the external bathroom is used by guests from two only rooms + now we had a direct entrance to the terrace. It is important to mark that all this is for a wonderful value. Other hotels at this price range seemed run of the mill, none had this kind of an authentic vibe. All in all, we loved our trip to Rome and we highly recommend Abitazione Pigneto if you do not mind spending some time on public transport while you go sight-seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Outside the main city but very close by”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this B&B outside the main part of the city. As we anticipated being sleep deprived and our first time in Rome, we arranged for Giorgio to pick us up at the airport. His service was less than taking a taxi cab. He was animated and shared his love of the city. As we were driving to his residence, we mentioned that we would be meeting friends the next morning. He made a detour and showed us where we would be meeting and where the bus stop/subway station was. He didn't want us to get lost! He gave us a map as well and on the backside of the map how to get back if you are at Colosseum, Vatican, etc. The residence was on the 4th floor of a building a block off a main street. We stayed in the room with the queen bed which was very comfortable. The room was clean though small. We had no place to put our suitcase when it was opened other than our bed. On the main street we could catch the bus or tram to take into the historic part of Rome. The street behind the B&B was a pedestrian mall where farmers sold their goods during the day and cafes and bars set their tables and chairs out in the evening. On the pedestrian mall was a supermarket where we were able to buy wine, cheese, bread to have in on the terrace off our bedroom in the afternoons/evenings. The shared bathroom was not a problem and always available for our use. We were served breakfast either on the terrace or in the small common room. Breakfast was somewhat minimal - delicious juice, a few slices of cheese, meat and a slice of dry toast each. The negative that we had is the noise in the evening. We had the door open to the terrace and could hear music from the nearby bars, breaking of glass, automobile alarms going off. We went to sleep one night to a combination of Johnny Cash's "Ring of Fire" and an Elvis Presley medley. That went on till about 3 AM. If we were younger, we probably would have loved it but being in our late 50's and mid 60's, we were tired and wanted to go to sleep at midnight! We were leaving for a cruise and Flavio drove us to the Port which made it very convenient for us. Giorgio and Flavio were excellent hosts. A great place to stay, convenient to many things. It was a wonderful value for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Greate place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Czerwi
Reviews.Content: A the begining of 2011 I was visiting Italy with my girlfriend, Rome was a 'must see' place during the trip. We stayed 4 nights in this cute B&B, really amazed by its owners hospitality and kindness. Giorgio (owner) gave us a lot of advices where to go and what too see, what is overrated and how to travel around the town in the fastest way. If you have any problem the owner is living at a flat next to B&B, but I doubt that you will have any. Place is divided into 3 rooms for guests, one of them have private bathroom, two others share one. There is also a kitchen with refrigerator for personal use, computer with free internet, maps and pocket guides. Everything is really clean and cozy. It`s a pity that his place is a little bit far from interesting places (thats why i didnt give max stars), although there is a bus and tram stop nearby. We walked a lot around Rome and usually go back to B&B by foot - even at late night. As Giorgio said neighborhood is safe and you sholud only look out for pickpockets. Nearby you can find shops, cafes and quite good places to having something to eat. At night many bars are being opened and you can taste Italian wine or beer. In short words - if only it was a little bit closer to the center it would be really perfect. If you dont mind traveling by bus or by foot to get to interesting places - you won`t be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B, great owners, great location!”
Reviews.Author: lulu1046
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just loved our stay here - this cute little B&B is located in an apartment slightly out of the main super touristy parts of Rome, so it has a more authentic Italian feel (but is still conveniently close enough & accessible with the 81 bus which gets you just about everywjere). Giorgio, the owner, was extremely kind and hospitable - he was also flexible with us leaving our bags and having us drop off our room key later to work with our late departure. It was nice having our own private bathroom which was spacious (note: the water pressure wasn't the greatest and there was a slight smell at times - not sure if that was from outside or inside). That aside, the room was great, decorated with different art on the wall, shutter windows with a view, our room had a TV (which we didn't ever use - who comes to Rome to watch TV anyway :-) . There is no wireless at this B&B but there is a computer with internet that you're free to use. Breakfast each morning was great - delicious meats & cheeses, toast, juice & coffee - a real plus that we missed when we stayed at other hotels without breakfast (saves you time & $ in getting started with your day!). There is a nearby market open daily with delicious fruits, colourful clothes, and other items (on Sunday it was more of an interesting yard sale/antique display), which is fun to check out on your way to the bus stop. All in all, this B&B suited our needs. It has friendly owners, a great location, is close to transit, and is in a safe & quieter neighbourhood. I'd definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place...”
Reviews.Author: kailoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Abitazione Pigneto in June 2011 for 3 days. Giorgio and Flavio has taken good care of us during our stay and have given us lots of good advise in regards to Rome. I would give this B&B a 5 star rating. Highly recommended if you are looking to live like an Italian in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation for a good price and very pleasant host. Highly recommended place for your stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: kinderici
Reviews.Content: We have found Abitazione Pigneto on the internet while looking for affordable accommodation for our 3 days stay in Rome. I am really grateful to have found this B&B. As mentioned before, this is a private appartment whose hosts are Giorgio and Fulvio who live on the very same floor. The appartment has 3 rooms, 2 sharing the same bathroom and 1 having its own bathroom. We had the room with the private bathroom. Everything very clean, quiet during the night - though the place is close to a pedestrian area - nice breakfast at the time requested by us...I felt better than in a hotel. Giorgio and Fulvio really try to offer the best services to their guest. We could benefit for a very good price of pick-up from the airport very late in the night and driving back at the airport very early in the morning. Thank you Giorgio for having woken up so early! The B&B is at 2 minutes from a bus stop which allows to catch a bus to the city center and close to 2 tram lines who brings you in 15 minutes to the Termini Railway station. Really convenient location and very welcoming hosts! I know for sure where I will stay next time when in Rome. All my best to Giorgio and Fulvio!

Reviews.Title: “Good value...good hosts”
Reviews.Author: maratmassen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our stay in Rome and generally found it very pleasant. This is less a hotel than a flat that the owner uses as a place to stay. Giorgio, the owner, picked us up from the airport for a good price and was great about helping us up figure out where to go and how to get there. Breakfast is included in our price. The value is unbeatable and I would suggest booking directly with Giorgio and not with a third party website because your rate will be lower. The room we had was comfortable, though we shared a bathroom with another room (there is a room that has its own bathroom that is more expensive). The only marginal downside of this hotel is that it is located outside the center of Rome near Ponte Casilino and so it's a bit challenging to get to the tourist sites. It took us about a half day to learn the transportation and there are buses and a light rail that connect you quickly. But, it adds time to your day and it is something consider. However, Ponte Casilino is a very cool location in itself, there are a lot of restaurants and bars within a block of the hotel and they are very authentic. Overall, a good value, good service and a very interesting location.

Reviews.Title: “clean, well decorated and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MadinahLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this cozy apartment with my husband and sister who was visitng from Alaska after reading good reviews about it. we were not disappointed as we found the apartment was clean, well decorated with comfortable beds. Breakfast was always ready at the time we requested it. Georgio, the owner was the best host we have ever had. He was always available when we needed him and attended to our needs. He was so helpful with advising us on everything from the places to visit to buses and trams as well as the times. He picked us from the airport and had even offered to take us back at a fair charge but we had already purchased our trains tickets back to the airport. Giorgio offered to come with with us to train station on way to the airport and helped carry our heavy bags on the escalators which we were very grateful for considering that my husband had had to leave before us to catch an earlier flight.

Reviews.Title: “All we needed”
Reviews.Author: Erwin73
Reviews.Content: I wanted to show my girlfriend the beautiful city of Rome and found this nicely priced B&B on Tripadvisor. All I can do, is giving Giorgio and Fulvio the credits for their wonderful place to stay. Yes, the breakfast is somewhat simple and it´s not located in the city centre. But both bus and tram stops are nearby, so within a quarter of an hour you are downtown. Goirgio drove us from the airport to their place, which is more advisable if your flight arrives late. He provided us with useful info about Rome and the neighbourhood of the Abitazione Pigneto. Nice restaurants, do´s and dont´s etc. So if you want a nice clean place to stay for a fair price and taking the tram or bus to the centre is not a problem, then Abitazione Pigneto is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “We felt right at home here!”
Reviews.Author: maz49
Reviews.Content: Although a little far out from the city centre, although there is a tram stop very close by, we loved staying at Giorgio's B&B. We felt very welcomed, Giorgio was very helpful and the place was clean and well kept. Considering how expensive accommodation in Italy can be I'd definietly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - Best place we stayed on our honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: MelandChrisHere
Reviews.Content: Georgio and Fulvio are wonderful people. Georgio picked us up from the airport on-time and brought us straight to his B&B. During the drive he was pointing out places where we should visit and explained the bus system (not that difficult to understand). When we arrived, he showed us to our room which was much larger then anticipated. There was a large queen size bed as well as a smaller day bed. The doors to the shared terrace was a treat. Georgio has a very large collection of cacti. The terrace overlooks the neighborhood. The neighborhood is welcoming and very safe. Breakfast was perfect! Meat, cheese, toast (jam and butter), coffee and juice. We were able to eat at any time we wanted. The entire time that we stayed at Abitazione Pigneto, we felt as though we were at home. I recommend this B&B to everyone. C and M

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: cinnyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this B&B for five nights in July while my husband took a mosaic class around the corner. We had alot of fun! Giorgio and Fulvio are great hosts! Once we figured out the bus and subway system(which is easy) we were able to get around Rome with no problem. The room and bathroom were extremly clean. We also were able to use the computer that is in the apartment, which is a nice touch. Breakfast was good. Giorgio has great reccomendations of places to see while in Rome. I would highly reccomend this Bed&Breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Want a slice of real Roman life? Stay at the Pigneto . . .”
Reviews.Author: vershaz
Reviews.Content: The Abitazione Pigneto is located in an apartment building in a beautiful tree-lined neighbourhood in the suburbs of Rome. It about twenty minutes from the Colosseum by bus, which you can catch at a bus stop just a two minute walk away (a line on that stop also takes you directly to Termini station). The bed and breakfast is run by Giorgio and his business partner Fulvio, who are gracious hosts. We stayed here three nights and had a great experience. The B&B is actually an apartment with three bedrooms, a shared bath, a kitchen, a dining room, and an entrance hall. Giorgio and Fulvio live across the hall on the same floor, but the B&B was originally Giorgio's home and he still treats it as such. He loves the flat and the dynamic interplay of eclectic and colorful furnishings in each room, especially the artwork and artifacts littered everywhere, reflects it; it truly feels like a home and feels very "Roman." Our room was large and had an extra day-bed in it. Our bed was low to the ground, but comfortable. There is a shared balcony for some of the rooms, which looks over the street and the neighbourhood. We didn't find it noisy at all, except for a few cars gunning their engines around mid-evening. It's a real neighbourhood, so your view and experience will be of a real neighbourhood, but this is not a drawback. You'll truly believe you're living in Rome instead of just visiting. One thing: The neighbourhood around the Abitazione Pigneto is fine and very safe, even at night. There are families everywhere, along with nice restaurants, cafes, businesses, etc. tucked into the well kept-up apartment buildings. However, there are large groups of men that hang out at all times of the day around the bus stop area; this may be because there is a mosque or at least a men's meeting center nearby, but it is nothing to be particularly worried about. Cars and motorbikes in this area dart through the streets, too, and aren't very forgiving, so watch out! We asked Giorgio to pick us up from Ciampino airport, as we would have had no clue how to get to the B&B on our own. While the pick-up price is a bit steep (25 euros for Ciampino, 35 for da Vinci), we've very glad we asked him. We got a very unique tour of greater Rome, including zipping around and through ancient aqueducts, and also gained a lot of insight on touring Rome from Giorgio. He helps you with figuring out bus tickets, which are your key to the city, and also recommended a fabulous, 'real' Italian restaurant just a block from the B&B. Also, Giorgio insisted we get on the bus (either the 81 or 810) the moment we arrived to go see the Colosseum at sunset; it's a treat and very easy to do, and we're happy he suggested it. Fulvio is the one who will typically take care of you -- he handles breakfast, cleans the rooms, and probably will deal with check-out or storing your bags for the day. He does not speak English, but does speak some French and Spanish; however, he's nice and the language barrier won't be a problem as long as you learn a few phrases in Italian. Breakfast is very basic -- cheese, meat, butter, jam, toast, coffee, and juice -- and could be more. You can have it at whatever time you want in the morning, though, which was great. There are also numerous trattorias, cafes, restaurants, and markets in the immediate area, too, if you're ever looking for a quick snack or a late dinner. We had a lovely time here. Giorgio and Fulvio are very kind, and have a vested interest in aiding travelers because they travel a lot themselves. This is much to their credit in making their us feel comfortable and helping us have a positive experience. Despite the somewhat long distance from the city centre, I don't think we could have had a better experience in Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great little B&B”
Reviews.Author: tarahsbudd
Reviews.Content: I booked this B&B through Venere in August 2006 at 55 euros a night, and was very pleased with it. The room was large and very clean, with a high ceiling, a large TV, two large windows that opened into the center "courtyard" area of the building (though not a pretty view), and it had a large bed plus a twin daybed, two nightstands with lamps and a marble-topped table and chair for writing or eating. The room is decorated in a sort of eclectic artsy antique style with lots of original artwork, and I found the large bed to be very comfortable. The attached bathroom is also very large and clean, tiled completely in lovely porcelain, with high ceilings, a large tub with a hand-held shower attachment, an area for hanging clothes, and a cabinet for storing folded clothes and shoes. The bathroom counter is marble and nice and large for all of us women's stuff! Overall, I didn't find it to be very noisy at night, but I always wear earplugs, so that helps. The owners, Fulvio and Giorgio, are wonderful people, very helpful about helping you find your way around the city, and very conscientious about everything, including a lovely breakfast on MY schedule. Incidentally, Fulvio picked me up at the Fiumicino airport for 35 euros, so it was nice not to have to deal with taxis. Also FYI, Giorgio speaks fluent English but he's not usually there during the day, and Fulvio speaks very little English, so be sure to brush up on the most common phrases! The neighborhood is a bit "dodgy" perhaps, in an ethnic area of the Prenestina neighborhood, but it is still very safe, even for an attractive single woman (I was never molested by anyone), and there are all kinds of markets, farmacia, cafes, a wine bar and other shops within very close walking distance. There is also a bus stop and a tram stop (cable-car) within one block.

Reviews.Title: “room next to shared bath was noisy with other people using it at night”
Reviews.Author: Hemant_Saraswat
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights. Location is not central but easy to reach by tram 5 or 14 from termini. Host is friendly and informative. Our room was next to the shared bath and guests staying in the other room used the bathroom for hours at odd hours. It was very noisy everytime they opened the water tap and they did it until 2 in the morning. breakfast was decent. I wouldn't stay in the room next to the bathroom if there are other guests at the time. I think the host should mention this in the B&B information that the bathroom is shared and can be noisy.

HotelInfo.Name: Abitazione Pigneto
HotelInfo.Address: Via Perugia, 16, 00176 Rome, Italy
